bugs.title: CVE-2017-20189 clojure: executes arbitrary code upon deserialization

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-20189 clojure: executes arbitrary code upon deserialization

long_desc.thetext:
In Clojure before 1.9.0, classes can be used to construct a serialized object that executes arbitrary code upon deserialization. This is relevant if a server deserializes untrusted objects.

https://clojure.atlassian.net/browse/CLJ-2204
https://github.com/clojure/clojure/commit/271674c9b484d798484d134a5ac40a6df15d3ac3
https://github.com/frohoff/ysoserial/pull/68/files
https://hackmd.io/%40fe1w0/HyefvRQKp
https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JAVA-ORGCLOJURE-5740378

Created clojure tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2259514]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2259515]

long_desc.thetext:
In Clojure before 1.9.0, classes can be used to construct a serialized object that executes arbitrary code upon deserialization. This is relevant if a server deserializes untrusted objects.

https://clojure.atlassian.net/browse/CLJ-2204
https://github.com/clojure/clojure/commit/271674c9b484d798484d134a5ac40a6df15d3ac3
https://github.com/frohoff/ysoserial/pull/68/files

Created clojure tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2259514]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2259515]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2259513

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2259513,2259514

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
FEDORA-EPEL-2024-54270ec4b3 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-54270ec4b3

FEDORA-EPEL-2024-54270ec4b3 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 testing repository.

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-54270ec4b3

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-EPEL-2024-54270ec4b3 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
